ground_truth: As the picture fades in, the bowling noises continue, but filtered and faint. We are close on the Dude, upside down. As the Dude opens his eyes, we spiral slowly upward to put him right side around. His head is now resting against a hardwood floor, not a rug. The rug is gone. We push Brandt down the familiar marble hallway. We pan off the Dude, driving, to his point of view through the front windshield. The headlights play over Walter standing waiting in front of the storefront of SOBCHAK SECURITY. Though he is wearing khaki shorts and a shirt, the fact that he holds a battered brown briefcase makes him look oddly like a commuter. He also holds an irregular shape bundled in brown wrapping paper. The car stops in front of him, and he opens the Dude's door and hands in the briefcase. The Dude takes the briefcase and slides over. He raises himself onto his elbows and massages the red lump on his jaw. The Dude unclips the phone from the battery pack. The Dude glares at Walter. Walter stares dumbly for a beat. The Dude is twisting around to pull the money briefcase from the back seat. Walter reaches one arm across the Dude's body to grab the laundry. There is the bump and new steady of the car on the bridge. He flings it out the window. Walter points across the seat at the paper-wrapped bundle. Walter has flung open his door and is leaning halfway out over the road. Walter rolls out with his parcel, giving a loud grunt as he hits the pavement. The car swerves and lurches, and the Dude, cursing, takes the wheel. Walter tumbles onto the shoulder and--RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT!--muzzle flashes tear open the wrapping paper. The car rocks, and the Dude wrestles with the wheel. The car clunks and screams around in a skid. The Dude is thrown forward as the car hits something. As the Dude struggles out holding the satchel of money, the Dude runs up the road toward the bridge, frantically waving the satchel in the air. WALTER is just rising from the ground, massaging an injured knee. The Dude and Walter stand in the middle of the road, watching the three red tail lights fishtail away. He turns from the lane to where the Dude sits in the nook of molded plastic chairs. The Dude listlessly holds the portable phone in his lap. Donny is trotting excitedly up. The Dude gets to his feet with the portable phone. He waves both arms as if conducting a symphony orchestra. The three bowlers, stopped at the edge of the lot, stare out at an empty parking space. The Dude walks away across the lot.

test_cases.name: Active <-> Passive Transformation
test_cases.description: As the picture is faded in, the bowling noises are continued, but they are being filtered and faint. The Dude is shown close-up, upside down. As his eyes are opened by the Dude, we are spiraled slowly upward to put him right side around. His head is now being rested against a hardwood floor, not a rug. The rug has been removed. Brandt is pushed by us down the familiar marble hallway. The Dude is panned off, driving, to show his point of view through the front windshield. The headlights are playing over Walter, who is standing waiting in front of the storefront of SOBCHAK SECURITY. Though khaki shorts and a shirt are worn by him, the fact that a battered brown briefcase is held by him makes him look oddly like a commuter. An irregular shape bundled in brown wrapping paper is also held by him. The car is stopped in front of him, and the Dude's door is opened by him and the briefcase is handed in. The briefcase is taken by the Dude and he slides over. He raises himself onto his elbows and the red lump on his jaw is massaged by him. The phone is unclipped from the battery pack by the Dude. Walter is glared at by the Dude. Walter dumbly stares for a beat. The Dude is twisted around to pull the money briefcase from the back seat. Walter reaches one arm across the Dude's body to grab the laundry. The bump and new steady of the car on the bridge is felt. It is flung out the window by Walter. The seat is pointed across by Walter at the paper-wrapped bundle. His door has been flung open by Walter and he is leaning halfway out over the road. With his parcel, Walter rolls out, giving a loud grunt as the pavement is hit by him. The car is swerved and lurched, and the wheel is taken by the Dude, cursing. Walter tumbles onto the shoulder and--RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT!--the wrapping paper is torn open by muzzle flashes. The car is rocked, and the wheel is wrestled with by the Dude. The car is clunked and screamed around in a skid. The Dude is thrown forward as something is hit by the car. As he struggles out holding the satchel of money, the satchel is waved frantically in the air by the Dude running up the road toward the bridge. From the ground, WALTER is just rising, massaging an injured knee. The Dude and Walter are standing in the middle of the road, watching the three red tail lights fishtail away. From the lane, he turns to where the Dude is sitting in the nook of molded plastic chairs. The portable phone is listlessly held by the Dude in his lap. Donny is excitedly trotting up. The portable phone is picked up by the Dude as he gets to his feet. He waves both arms as if a symphony orchestra is being conducted by him. The three bowlers, stopped at the edge of the lot, are staring out at an empty parking space. Across the lot, the Dude walks away.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L1
test_cases.description: As the scene begins, faint bowling noises are heard. We see the Dude, upside down. As he opens his eyes, we spiral upward, making him upright. His head rests on a hardwood floor; the rug is gone. Brandt is pushed down a familiar marble hallway. The Dude drives, viewing Walter through the windshield in front of SOBCHAK SECURITY. Walter, in khaki shorts and shirt, holds a battered briefcase, resembling a commuter, and a brown-wrapped shape. The car stops; he hands the Dude the briefcase. The Dude massages a lump on his jaw and glares at Walter, who stares blankly. The Dude retrieves the money briefcase from the back seat. Walter reaches over the Dude, grabs the laundry, and flings it out the window as the car bumps onto a bridge. Walter, leaning out, rolls onto the pavement, the parcel tearing open with muzzle flashes. The car swerves; the Dude curses and takes the wheel. The car skids, and the Dude is thrown forward upon impact. He exits, holding the money satchel, and runs toward the bridge, waving it. Walter rises, massaging an injured knee, as they watch three red tail lights disappear. The scene shifts to the Dude sitting in molded plastic chairs, holding a phone. Donny approaches excitedly, and the Dude stands, waving arms like a conductor. The three bowlers stare at an empty parking space, and the Dude walks across the lot.

test_cases.name: Brevity - L2
test_cases.description: As the picture fades in, filtered bowling noises continue. We focus on the Dude, upside down. As he opens his eyes, we spiral up to right him. His head rests on a hardwood floorâ€”the rug is gone. We follow Brandt down a marble hallway and pan to the Dude's view through the windshield. Headlights reveal Walter in front of SOBCHAK SECURITY, wearing khaki shorts and a shirt, holding a battered briefcase, appearing like a commuter. He also has a brown-wrapped bundle. The car stops; he hands the Dude the briefcase, and the Dude massages a red lump on his jaw. The Dude unclips the phone and glares at Walter. Walter stares blankly as the Dude grabs a money briefcase from the back seat. Walter reaches over for the bundle, throws it out the window, and rolls out, hitting the pavement. The car swerves as the Dude curses, taking the wheel. Muzzle flashes tear the wrapping paper as Walter tumbles out. The Dude wrestles with the wheel, and the car skids to a stop. Struggling out with the satchel, the Dude runs toward the bridge, waving it. Walter rises, massaging an injured knee, as they watch red tail lights fishtail away. The Dude sits in molded plastic chairs, holding a portable phone. Donny approaches excitedly. The Dude waves his arms like conducting a symphony, and the three bowlers stare at an empty parking space. The Dude walks away across the lot.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L1
test_cases.description: As the visual begins to clarify and the picture gradually emerges, the ambient sounds of bowling persist, although they are now filtered and muted. We are presented with the close-up image of the Dude, who is currently upside down. As the Dude's eyes slowly open, we embark on a gradual, spiraling ascent that gently and deliberately rotates his perspective until he is right side up. His head is now resting comfortably against a solid hardwood floor, a clear indication that the rug beneath him is no longer there; it has disappeared. Our viewpoint shifts, pushing us forward along the familiar expanse of the marble hallway with Brandt. We pan away from the Dude, who is driving, to capture his perspective through the front windshield of the car. The headlights sweep over the scene, illuminating Walter as he stands awaiting their arrival in front of the storefront emblazoned with the sign SOBCHAK SECURITY. Though Walter is casually dressed in khaki shorts and a shirt, the presence of a battered brown briefcase in his hand gives him the peculiar appearance of a commuter. In addition to the briefcase, he clutches a misshapen form bundled in brown wrapping paper. As the car comes to a halt directly in front of him, he opens the Dude's door and hands the briefcase over. The Dude receives the briefcase and slides over inside the vehicle. Propping himself up onto his elbows, he begins to massage a conspicuous red lump on his jaw. Next, the Dude disengages the phone from the attached battery pack. His gaze, intense and unwavering, fixes on Walter with a glare. Walter returns his look with a moment of dumbfounded silence, staring blankly. The Dude, meanwhile, twists around, contorting his body as he reaches to retrieve the money-filled briefcase from the back seat. Walter extends one arm across the Dude's torso in an attempt to grab the laundry. There's a distinct bump as the car stabilizes while crossing a bridge. With a sudden motion, Walter hurls the laundry out the window. Pointing deliberately across the seat, Walter indicates the bundle encased in paper. With a swift motion, he swings his door open and leans halfway out, precariously stretching over the road. Walter then rolls out of the moving car with his parcel in tow, emitting a loud grunt upon impact with the pavement. The car swerves erratically and jolts forward, prompting a stream of curses from the Dude as he takes control of the steering wheel. Walter tumbles onto the shoulder of the road, and at that moment, muzzle flashes burst from the wrapping paper with a staccato RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT. As the car rocks violently, the Dude wrestles with the steering wheel, trying to maintain control as the car screeches and veers into a skid. Thrown forward by the abrupt stop, the Dude extricates himself from the vehicle, clutching the satchel of money. With urgency, he races up the road toward the bridge, the satchel flailing wildly above his head. WALTER, just managing to rise from the ground, gingerly massages a sore knee. Together, the Dude and Walter stand in the middle of the road, observing as the three red tail lights fishtail into the distance. Walter turns away from the lane and directs his attention to where the Dude is seated within a cluster of molded plastic chairs. Holding the portable phone listlessly in his lap, the Dude appears distracted. Donny, filled with excitement, trots energetically up to them. The Dude stands, grasping the portable phone, and waves both arms in the air as though he is conducting a symphony orchestra. Meanwhile, three bowlers, having stopped at the boundary of the lot, gaze out with uncomprehending eyes at an empty parking spot. Finally, the Dude walks across the lot, moving away from the scene.

test_cases.name: Verbosity - L2

Propping himself up on his elbows, he starts to massage a conspicuous red lump on his jaw. Next, the Dude disconnects the phone from the attached battery pack. His gaze, intense and unwavering, fixes firmly on Walter with a piercing glare. Walter returns his look with a moment of dumbfounded silence, staring blankly. Meanwhile, the Dude twists around, contorting his body to reach into the back seat and retrieve the money-filled briefcase. Walter extends one arm across the Dude's torso, attempting to grab the laundry. There's a distinct bump as the car stabilizes while crossing a bridge. With a sudden motion, Walter hurls the laundry out the window. Pointing deliberately across the seat, Walter indicates the bundle encased in paper. With a swift motion, he swings his door open, leaning halfway out and precariously stretching over the road. Walter then rolls out of the moving car with his parcel in tow, emitting a loud grunt upon impact with the pavement. The car swerves erratically and jolts forward, prompting a stream of curses from the Dude as he takes control of the steering wheel. Walter tumbles onto the shoulder of the road, and at that moment, muzzle flashes burst forth from the wrapping paper with a staccato RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT. As the car rocks violently, the Dude wrestles with the steering wheel, striving to maintain control as the car screeches and veers into a skid. Thrown forward by the abrupt stop, the Dude extricates himself from the vehicle, clutching the satchel of money firmly. With urgency, he races up the road towards the bridge, the satchel flailing wildly above his head. WALTER, just managing to rise from the ground, gingerly massages a sore knee. Together, the Dude and Walter stand in the middle of the road, observing as the three red tail lights fishtail away into the distance. Walter turns away from the lane and directs his attention to where the Dude is seated amidst a cluster of molded plastic chairs. Holding the portable phone listlessly in his lap, the Dude appears distracted. Donny, filled with excitement, trots energetically up to join them. The Dude stands up, grasping the portable phone, and waves both arms in the air as if conducting a symphony orchestra. Meanwhile, three bowlers, having stopped at the boundary of the lot, gaze out with uncomprehending eyes at an empty parking spot. Finally, the Dude walks across the lot, moving away from the scene.

test_cases.name: Macro-Actions -> Micro-Actions
test_cases.description: As the screen gradually transitions from black to an image, the lingering sounds of bowling echo softly and distantly, encapsulating the surroundings. We are introduced to a close-up of the Dude, who is initially shown upside down. Slowly, his eyes flicker open, and as his awareness returns, the camera performs a gentle, spiraling movement, rotating upward to reorient the Dude, placing him upright in the frame. His head is now resting against a smooth, hardwood floor, which starkly contrasts with the absent rug that was once there. The rug is conspicuously missing. We transition to a scene where Brandt is being visually escorted down an opulent, marble hallway, a familiar setting that evokes a sense of dÃ©jÃ  vu. The view shifts away from the Dude, who is driving, focusing on his perspective through the front windshield. The scene becomes animated as the headlights illuminate Walter standing expectantly in front of the storefront labeled SOBCHAK SECURITY. Despite his casual attire of khaki shorts and a shirt, the presence of a battered brown briefcase in his hand lends him the appearance of a typical commuter. Along with the briefcase, Walter clutches an object of irregular contours, wrapped inconspicuously in brown paper. The car comes to a halt before Walter, who promptly opens the Dude's door and hands the briefcase inside. As the Dude accepts the briefcase, he shifts himself over on the seat, propping himself up onto his elbows to massage a red, tender lump forming on his jaw. He then unclips a phone attached to a battery pack, his attention momentarily diverted to glare skeptically at Walter. Walter, on the other hand, meets his gaze with a blank expression, which lingers for a brief moment. The Dude proceeds to twist his body around, reaching into the back seat to retrieve the briefcase filled with money. In a sudden movement, Walter extends his arm across the Dude's torso, snatching up some laundry. As the car proceeds onto a bridge, there is a noticeable bump followed by a smooth, steady transition. Walter hurriedly flings the laundry out of the window. Pointing decisively across the seat toward the bundle covered in paper, Walter opens his door wide and leans precariously over the road. With an assertive roll, he exits the vehicle, emitting a loud grunt upon contact with the pavement. The car goes into a swerve, jerking and lurching erratically, prompting the Dude, cursing under his breath, to seize control of the wheel. Walter's form is seen tumbling onto the roadside, and an abrupt sound of --RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT!-- punctuates the scene as muzzle flashes explosively unravel the wrapping paper. The vehicle rocks with force, while the Dude fiercely contends with the wheel. The situation escalates as the car produces a series of clunks and screeches, entering into a skid. The abrupt halt throws the Dude forward as the car collides with an object. Managing to extricate himself from the vehicle, he clutches the satchel containing money, sprinting up the road toward the bridge. His movements are frantic, wildly waving the satchel above his head. Meanwhile, Walter begins to rise from the ground, wincing and favoring an injured knee. The two, the Dude, and Walter, find themselves standing in the center of the road, observing as three sets of red tail lights veer erratically into the distance. Walter diverts his attention from the lane to the area where the Dude is seated among molded plastic chairs. The Dude appears drained, holding a portable phone listlessly in his lap. Donny, filled with excitement, trots eagerly toward them. In response, the Dude rises, grasping the portable phone, and begins to wave both arms energetically, as though orchestrating an imaginary symphony. Meanwhile, three bowlers, halted at the edge of the parking lot, look on, puzzled, at the now-vacant parking space before them. Finally, the Dude turns and walks away, crossing the expansive lot.

test_cases.name: Micro-Actions -> Macro-Actions
test_cases.description: The picture fades in with faint bowling noises. The Dude, initially upside down, opens his eyes as the perspective slowly corrects to reveal him on a hardwood floor, now rugless. Brandt wheels him down a familiar marble hallway, transitioning to the Dude's point of view through a car's windshield. Headlights illuminate Walter, standing in front of SOBCHAK SECURITY with a briefcase and a bundled object. As the car stops, Walter hands the briefcase to the Dude, who accepts it while massaging a red lump on his jaw, then detaches the phone from its battery pack. The Dude glares at Walter, who, after a moment of dumbfoundedness, reaches for the laundry from the back seat while the car bumps onto a bridge. Walter tosses the laundry out the window, gestures at the bundled parcel, then rolls out with it, grunting as he hits the pavement. The Dude curses, takes control of the wheel, and manages the car as Walter's parcel is hit by gunfire. The Dude struggles with the skidding car until it hits something, and he is thrown forward. Grabbing the money satchel, he runs toward the bridge, waving it frantically. Walter rises, rubbing an injured knee, and they look on as tail lights disappear. The scene shifts to the Dude sitting listlessly in molded plastic chairs, holding a portable phone. Donny approaches excitedly, prompting the Dude to stand and wave his arms in frustration, like conducting an orchestra. The trio of bowlers stare at an empty parking space before the Dude walks away across the lot.

test_cases.name: Insert Attributes, Emotions and Scene
test_cases.description: As the picture fades in, the bowling noises continue, but filtered and faint, reminiscent of the distinctive sounds of a busy bowling alley, where pins crash and balls rumble across polished lanes. We are close on the Dude, upside down. As the Dude opens his eyes, we spiral slowly upward to put him right side around. His head is now resting against a hardwood floor, not a rug. The rug, which held sentimental value, is gone. We push Brandt down the familiar marble hallway of a lavish mansion, where echoes of footsteps bounce off the luxurious surfaces. We pan off the Dude, driving, to his point of view through the front windshield. The headlights play over Walter standing waiting in front of the storefront of SOBCHAK SECURITY, the small but reputable firm he owns, known for its no-nonsense approach to personal safety. Though he is wearing khaki shorts and a shirt, the fact that he holds a battered brown briefcase makes him look oddly like a commuter in a bustling urban jungle. He also holds an irregular shape bundled in brown wrapping paper, suggesting a package perhaps intended for delivery. The car stops in front of him, and he opens the Dude's door and hands in the briefcase. The Dude takes the briefcase and slides over. He raises himself onto his elbows and massages the red lump on his jaw, evidence of a recent and unfortunate altercation. The Dude unclips the phone from the battery pack, a bulky relic from the early days of mobile technology. The Dude glares at Walter. Walter stares dumbly for a beat, as if momentarily bewildered by the unfolding chaos. The Dude is twisting around to pull the money briefcase, which holds an undisclosed amount, from the back seat. Walter reaches one arm across the Dude's body to grab the laundry, a mundane task amidst the madness. There is the bump and new steady of the car on the bridge, a structure spanning the city's winding river. He flings it out the window. Walter points across the seat at the paper-wrapped bundle. Walter has flung open his door and is leaning halfway out over the road, his military training evident in the precision of his movements. Walter rolls out with his parcel, giving a loud grunt as he hits the pavement, a maneuver known in tactical circles as a "combat roll." The car swerves and lurches, and the Dude, cursing, takes the wheel. Walter tumbles onto the shoulder and--RAT-TAT-TAT-TAT!--muzzle flashes tear open the wrapping paper, revealing hidden surprises best left unspoken. The car rocks, and the Dude wrestles with the wheel. The car clunks and screams around in a skid. The Dude is thrown forward as the car hits something, likely a roadside barrier. As the Dude struggles out holding the satchel of money, desperate to keep it safe, the Dude runs up the road toward the bridge, frantically waving the satchel in the air. WALTER is just rising from the ground, massaging an injured knee, a testament to the rough landing. The Dude and Walter stand in the middle of the road, watching the three red tail lights fishtail away, marking the escape of a mysterious vehicle. He turns from the lane to where the Dude sits in the nook of molded plastic chairs, common fixtures in budget motels and waiting rooms. The Dude listlessly holds the portable phone in his lap. Donny, their loyal friend often underestimated, is trotting excitedly up. The Dude gets to his feet with the portable phone. He waves both arms as if conducting a symphony orchestra, his mind perhaps echoing with the crescendos of a masterpiece. The three bowlers, stopped at the edge of the lot, stare out at an empty parking space, once occupied by their now-absent vehicle. The Dude walks away across the lot.

test_cases.name: Addition (~80%)
test_cases.description: As the picture fades in the bowling noises continue but filtered and faint. We are close on the Dude upside down. As the Dude opens his eyes we spiral slowly upward to put him right side around. His head is now resting against a hardwood floor not a rug. The rug is gone. We push Brandt down the familiar marble hallway. We pan off the Dude driving to his point of view through the front windshield. The headlights play over Walter standing waiting in front of the storefront of SOBCHAK SECURITY. Though he is wearing khaki shorts and a shirt the fact that he holds a battered brown briefcase makes him look oddly like a commuter. He also holds an irregular shape bundled in brown wrapping paper. The car stops in front of him and he opens the Dude's door and hands in the briefcase. The Dude takes the briefcase and slides over. He raises himself onto his elbows and massages the red lump on his jaw. The Dude unclips the phone from the battery pack. The Dude glares at Walter. Walter stares dumbly for a beat. The Dude is twisting around to pull the money briefcase from the back seat. Walter reaches one arm across the Dude's body to grab the laundry. There is the bump and new steady of the car on the bridge. In the neonlit back alleys of a dystopian metropolis a rogue hacker races against time while being chased by relentless cyborg enforcers their footsteps echoing off rainsoaked pavement. Under the relentless desert sun a lone gunslinger confronts a notorious outlaw at a deserted crossroads both men exchanging steely glances as swirling dust blurs the horizon. On a foggy evening in Victorian London an intrepid detective uncovers a hidden conspiracy among the cityâ€™s elite with gaslit streets setting the stage for a race against a mounting darkness. High above a sprawling city skyline a daredevil pilot executes deathdefying maneuvers in a vintage biplane narrowly evading enemy fire as the ground morphs into a dizzying mosaic below. Within the creaking walls of an old countryside manor an estranged family gathers for a mysterious inheritance their hushed whispers and secret glances weaving a tapestry of betrayal and suspense. Amidst the roaring tempest of a stormy ocean a weathered sailor battles natureâ€™s fury on a creaking vessel his resolve as steadfast as the crashing waves that threaten to engulf him. On a bustling 1960s New York street a passionate artist finds unexpected inspiration in the chaotic interplay of urban life capturing moments of love loss and defiant hope on a rainsoaked canvas. Deep in the heart of an enchanted forest a brave knight embarks on a perilous quest to rescue a captive princess facing mythical creatures and treacherous traps with unwavering courage. During a heated political rally in a futuristic city a charismatic leader stokes both hope and dissent. as holographic banners illuminate the night sky and fervent crowds surge with anticipation. In the eerie silence of a postapocalyptic wasteland a hardened survivor scavenges through abandoned ruins haunted by the echoes of a oncethriving civilization now reduced to dust. Beneath the shimmering surface of an underwater kingdom a rebellious mermaid defies ancient traditions to explore forbidden coral reefs and secret caverns brimming with forgotten lore. In the quiet confines of a suburban attic an unassuming teenager stumbles upon a mysterious portal that thrusts him into a surreal world where the very fabric of time and space unravels. On the rugged highlands of Scotland a stoic warrior faces rival clans and ancient curses alike his fierce battle cry resonating across mistcovered moors and turbulent skies. Amid the vibrant chaos of a South American carnival a fearless dancer twirls through streets bursting with color and rhythm each graceful move challenging the rigid boundaries of tradition. During a clandestine meeting in a snowcovered mountain lodge two rival spies exchange cryptic messages hinting at an imminent global conspiracy. their whispered words carried off by the howling wind. Inside a lavish 1920s speakeasy a troubled jazz musician pours his soul into a melancholic melody every note echoing the bittersweet memories of lost love and shattered dreams. In a futuristic space station orbiting a distant planet an intrepid crew confronts bizarre alien phenomena and an enigmatic interstellar threat pushing the limits of human endurance. Amidst the chaos of a raging civil war a compassionate medic races through bombedout streets. his every desperate step a race against time to save lives in the midst of utter devastation. On a sundappled afternoon in a quaint European village an eccentric inventor unveils a groundbreaking contraption that defies conventional physics igniting wonder and skepticism in equal measure. In a bustling marketplace in ancient Persia a cunning street thief navigates labyrinthine alleyways and vibrant bazaars. his calculated every move a daring escape from the everwatchful royal guards. He flings it out the window. Walter points across the seat at the paperwrapped bundle. Walter has flung open his door and is leaning halfway out over the road. Walter rolls out with his parcel giving a loud grunt as he hits the pavement. The car swerves and lurches and the Dude cursing takes the wheel. Walter tumbles onto the shoulder andRATTATTATTATmuzzle flashes tear open the wrapping paper. The car rocks and the Dude wrestles with the wheel. The car clunks and screams around in a skid. The Dude is thrown forward as the car hits something. As the Dude struggles out holding the satchel of money the Dude runs up the road toward the bridge frantically waving the satchel in the air. WALTER is just rising from the ground massaging an injured knee. The Dude and Walter stand in the middle of the road watching the three red tail lights fishtail away. He turns from the lane to where the Dude sits in the nook of molded plastic chairs. The Dude listlessly holds the portable phone in his lap. Donny is trotting excitedly up. The Dude gets to his feet with the portable phone. He waves both arms. as if conducting a symphony orchestra. The three bowlers stopped at the edge of the lot stare out at an empty parking space. The Dude walks away across the lot.

test_cases.name: Subject-Action-Object Corruption
test_cases.description: As the canvas materializes, the balloon whispers persist, but muted and distant. We are tight on the Cat, sideways. As the Cat lifts its ears, we swirl gently downward to set it upright. Its paw is now resting against a marble countertop, not a pillow. The pillow is absent. We tug Oliver down the known granite corridor. We tilt off the Cat, flying, to its perspective through the rear window. The lantern beams over Charlie standing waiting ahead of the gate of BLUTARSKY GARDENS. Although he is sporting denim trousers and a jacket, the notion that he carries a dented blue tote bag makes him seem strangely like a tourist. He also grasps a peculiar object swathed in purple tissue paper. The bicycle halts beside him, and he unfastens the Cat's hatch and passes in the tote bag. The Cat receives the tote bag and rolls aside. It lifts itself onto its knees and rubs the green blemish on its cheek. The Cat detaches the remote from the power box. The Cat glowers at Charlie. Charlie gazes blankly for a moment. The Cat is twisting around to fetch the candy basket from the trunk. Charlie extends one leg across the Cat's body to snatch the newspaper. There is the tremor and strange calm of the bicycle on the dock. He tosses it through the hatch. Charlie gestures across the trunk at the tissue-wrapped object. Charlie has flung open his hatch and is leaning halfway out above the trail. Charlie rolls out with his package, emitting a loud huff as he lands on the dirt. The bicycle veers and jerks, and the Cat, swearing, grabs the helm. Charlie rolls onto the path and--POP-POP-POP-POP!--sparks explode from the tissue wrapper. The bicycle sways, and the Cat grapples with the helm. The bicycle clanks and wails around in a spin. The Cat is tossed backward as the bicycle hits something. As the Cat fumbles out clutching the pouch of candies, the Cat dashes up the path toward the dock, desperately waving the pouch in the air. CHARLIE is just lifting from the earth, stroking a bruised elbow. The Cat and Charlie stand at the center of the trail, witnessing the three blue tail lights veer away. He shifts from the track to where the Cat sits in the recess of carved wooden benches. The Cat idly cradles the cell in its arms. Frankie is prancing eagerly up. The Cat stands with the cell. It waves both paws as if orchestrating a jazz band. The three dancers, paused at the brink of the park, gaze out at an empty meadow. The Cat strolls away across the park.

test_cases.name: Complete Corruption
test_cases.description: The film starts with a man waking up in a small apartment. He prepares coffee and checks his phone for messages. There are none, so he heads out to catch a bus. On the way, he passes a neighbor who greets him briefly. At the bus stop, he notices a group of students talking about an upcoming test. He boards the bus and sits near the back, watching the city pass by outside the window. After a few stops, he gets off near a large office building. He enters the lobby and goes through security. He rides an elevator to the tenth floor, where he works as an assistant. His manager asks him to prepare some documents for a meeting later in the day. He collects files from different departments and organizes them in a conference room. Another employee asks him for help with a software issue, so he takes a few minutes to fix it. Then he returns to the conference room to double-check everything before the meeting begins. The meeting starts at noon. Several people join via video call, and others sit around the table. The manager outlines the project goals, and each team member shares updates on their tasks. There are questions about deadlines and budgets, but no big surprises. After an hour, they end the call. The manager thanks everyone and leaves. The assistant cleans up the room, collects leftover notes, and heads back to his desk. During lunch, he walks to a nearby cafÃ©, where he orders a simple meal. He eats alone and checks social media on his phone. After lunch, he returns to the office and finishes smaller tasks, such as sending emails and filing paperwork. He also helps a coworker carry boxes of supplies to another floor. Later in the afternoon, the manager calls him in to discuss next week's schedule. They go over a few changes, and the assistant updates the calendar. When the workday ends, he logs off his computer and leaves the building. Outside, he walks a few blocks to meet a friend. They chat about weekend plans and decide to see a film on Saturday. The assistant then heads home on a crowded bus. At his apartment, he sorts his mail, feeds a pet cat, and warms up leftovers for dinner. He watches a short news segment on TV, then checks his phone again. A message from his friend confirms their plan for the weekend. He feels relieved to have something to look forward to. The film ends with him preparing for bed, setting an alarm, and turning off the lights. He reflects briefly on the day, thinking about his tasks, his quiet home, and the plans ahead.

test_cases.name: Summarization
test_cases.description: As the scene opens, faint bowling noises are heard. The Dude is shown upside down, awakening and realizing he's on a hardwood floor, and the rug is gone. We see Walter standing outside SOBCHAK SECURITY, holding a briefcase that gives him a commuter-like appearance, along with a bundle wrapped in brown paper. Walter hands the Dude the briefcase, and as the Dude massages a lump on his jaw, he glares at Walter. Walter suddenly flings a bundle from the car window as the car bumps onto a bridge, leans out with his parcel, and rolls out, hitting the pavement. As the Dude struggles with the wheel, the car skids and stops suddenly. The Dude grabs his satchel of money, runs towards the bridge, and waves it frantically. Walter, injured, rises as they watch taillights disappear. The Dude, holding a phone, gets up as Donny approaches excitedly. The trio of bowlers stares at an empty parking space before the Dude walks away across the lot.
